active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a class debate, argue the pros and cons of relying primarily on IoCs versus TTPs in continuous intelligence feeds for threat hunting. Use real-world examples from MITRE ATT&CK to support your position and evaluate how optimization techniques like prioritization can mitigate limitations of each.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in 'Continuous Intelligence Feed Optimization' (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Threat Intelligence And Hunting > Threat Intelligence Frameworks > 015_011_Advanced Topics and Emerging Trends > Threat Intelligence Automation > Continuous Intelligence Feed Optimization). Generate 50 high-quality flashcards optimized for spaced repetition and Bloom's Taxonomy. Cover all scaffolding layers progressively (Layer 1: Foundation - definitions like CTI, IoCs, TTPs, TI types; Layer 2: Components - lifecycle/sources; Layer 3: Implementation - optimization steps/dedup/prioritize/SIEM; Layer 4: Integration - AI fusion/metrics/hunting). Incorporate learning objectives: [insert full list above]. Tie to active learning: discussion on IoCs vs TTPs, peer teaching layers, problem-solving with mock feeds. Use exact flashcard schema: - Front: Question (mix: 20% definition, 30% MCQ w/4 opts, 20% T/F, 15% cloze, 15% scenario/apply). - Back: **Answer:** (bold keys). **Explanation:** (detailed, layer/research link, example). **Bloom Level:** (specify). **Distractors Expl:** (for MCQ/TF: why each wrong). Distractor protocol: Plausible errors (e.g., mix TI types, ignore metrics). Ensure completeness: Full TI types (Strategic: trends/exec; Operational: campaigns; Tactical: IoCs/TTPs), techniques (dedup, filter, ML), tools (MISP/STIX), metrics (FPR/latency). Output as JSON array: [{'front': '...', 'back': {'answer': '...', 'explanation': '...', 'bloom_level': '...', 'distractors_expl': '...'}}, ...]. Vary difficulty, ensure pedagogical depth for university-level threat hunting.
